Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Enchiladas

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to a culinary adventure that brings the vibrant flavors of Mexico right to your dinner table! In this article, we will explore a mouthwatering recipe for Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Enchiladas that are not only easy to prepare but also packed with delicious ingredients. Whether you’re a busy parent looking for a quick weeknight meal or a cooking enthusiast wanting to impress your guests, this recipe has you covered. Using simple pantry staples like boneless chicken breasts, enchilada sauce, and a blend of spices, you can create a rich and satisfying dish that will have your family asking for seconds. Plus, with the convenience of a slow cooker, you can set it and forget it, allowing you to focus on other tasks while your meal cooks to perfection. Get ready to dive into a world of flavor with these delectable enchiladas that are sure to become a new family favorite!

Ingredients

boneless chicken breasts

Use skinless, boneless chicken breasts for a leaner option. If you don't have chicken breasts, chicken thighs work well for a juicier result. You can also use rotisserie chicken to save time—just shred it and add it to the slow cooker at the end.

enchilada sauce

For a homemade touch, use a blend of tomato sauce, chili powder, cumin, and a bit of lime juice. If you're out of enchilada sauce, salsa or a combination of diced tomatoes with spices can work as a substitute.

tortillas (corn or flour)

Corn tortillas give a traditional flavor, but if you prefer a softer texture, use flour tortillas. To prevent tearing, warm the tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave before filling.

black beans

Choose low-sodium black beans to control salt levels. If you're out of black beans, pinto beans or kidney beans can be used as substitutes. For added flavor, rinse and sauté the beans with spices before adding them to the dish.

corn

Fresh corn can be used if in season; just cut it off the cob. Frozen corn is a great alternative and requires no preparation. Canned corn is also acceptable—just drain and rinse to reduce sodium.

shredded cheese (cheddar or Mexican blend)

Mix different cheeses like Monterey Jack or pepper jack for added flavor. If you're looking for a lower-fat option, use reduced-fat cheese, but keep in mind it may not melt as well.

onion (diced)

Sweet onions like Vidalia can add a milder flavor, while yellow onions provide a classic taste. For a deeper flavor, sauté the onions before adding them to the slow cooker.

garlic (minced)

Fresh garlic provides the best flavor, but you can use garlic powder as a substitute (1/8 teaspoon per clove). For a milder flavor, roast the garlic before mincing.

cumin

Cumin adds a warm, earthy flavor. If you don’t have cumin, coriander can be used as a substitute, though it will change the flavor profile.

chili powder

Adjust the amount of chili powder based on your heat preference. If you want a spicier kick, add cayenne pepper or use a hot chili powder blend.

salt

Start with a small amount of salt, and adjust to taste at the end, especially since the enchilada sauce and cheese can be salty.

pepper

Freshly ground black pepper enhances flavor better than pre-ground. For a twist, try using smoked pepper for a deeper taste.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Slow Cooker

    Place the chicken breasts in the bottom of the slow cooker.

  • Step 2: Add Enchilada Sauce

    Pour 1 cup of enchilada sauce over the chicken to infuse flavor.

  • Step 3: Mix Seasonings

    Add the diced onion, minced garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper on top of the chicken.

  • Step 4: Cook the Chicken

    Cover and cook on low for 6 hours or high for 3 hours until the chicken is fully cooked and shreds easily.

  • Step 5: Shred the Chicken

    Once cooked, use two forks to shred the chicken directly in the slow cooker.

  • Step 6: Combine Ingredients

    Add the black beans and corn to the shredded chicken and mix well.

  • Step 7: Prepare Baking Dish

    In a baking dish, spread a layer of enchilada sauce on the bottom to prevent sticking.

  • Step 8: Assemble Enchiladas

    Take a tortilla, fill it with the chicken mixture, sprinkle some cheese inside, roll it up, and place it seam side down in the baking dish.

  • Step 9: Repeat Assembly

    Repeat with the remaining tortillas and chicken mixture until all are used.

  • Step 10: Top with Sauce and Cheese

    Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the top of the rolled enchiladas and sprinkle the remaining cheese on top.

  • Step 11: Bake to Finish

    Cover with foil and cook on low for an additional 30 minutes to melt the cheese, or until heated through.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare chicken breasts for cooking?

Start by rinsing the chicken breasts under cold water and patting them dry with paper towels. Trim any excess fat or sinew with a sharp knife.

What can I use instead of enchilada sauce?

You can substitute enchilada sauce with salsa or a homemade mixture of tomato sauce with spices like cumin and chili powder.

How do I ensure my onions are diced evenly?

To dice an onion, cut it in half from top to bottom, then make horizontal and vertical cuts before chopping it into small pieces. This will help achieve even-sized pieces.

How do I know when the chicken is fully cooked?

Chicken is fully cooked when it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). If you don't have a meat thermometer, you can check if the chicken shreds easily with forks, indicating it's done.

What if I don't have a slow cooker?

You can make this recipe in an oven. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and cook the chicken in a covered baking dish for about 40-50 minutes, then proceed with assembling the enchiladas.

How do I prevent tortillas from tearing when rolling?

Warm the tortillas slightly in the microwave or on a skillet for a few seconds. This will make them more pliable and easier to roll without tearing.

What is the best way to shred chicken?

Once the chicken is cooked, use two forks to pull the meat apart. Hold one fork in the shredded chicken and use the other to pull it apart.

How can I make this dish spicier?

Add diced jalapeños or a dash of hot sauce to the chicken mixture before rolling the enchiladas for an extra kick.

How do I store leftovers?

Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days. You can also freeze the enchiladas for up to 3 months.

What can I serve with enchiladas?

Enchiladas pair well with a simple green salad, Mexican rice, or refried beans for a complete meal.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

To cater to dietary preferences, consider using gluten-free tortillas for those with gluten sensitivities. For a vegetarian option, substitute the chicken with sautéed mushrooms or zucchini, and increase the amount of black beans and corn. Additionally, vegan cheese can replace shredded cheese for a dairy-free alternative.

Pairings

For a complete meal experience, serve the Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Enchiladas with a side of Mexican rice or refried beans for added texture and flavor. Fresh guacamole, salsa, and sour cream make excellent dipping options. Pair these enchiladas with a crisp, refreshing beverage like a light lager, a margarita, or a fruity agua fresca to balance the spiciness.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the enchiladas hot from the oven, garnished with fresh cilantro, diced avocados, or sliced jalapeños for an extra kick. Offer lime wedges on the side for a zesty finish. Present the dish in a colorful, vibrant serving platter to enhance the visual appeal, making it perfect for family gatherings or casual parties.

#

Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Enchiladas

375 min
$15
400 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 6

Allergens:

dairy

Dietary Tags:

gluten-freehigh-protein

Cuisine:

Mexican

Course:

Main Course

Tags:

slow cookerMexicancomfort food

Description

Deliciously layered enchiladas cooked to perfection in a slow cooker, bursting with Mexican flavors!

Ingredients

  • boneless chicken breasts: 2 pounds
  • enchilada sauce: 2 cups
  • tortillas (corn or flour): 10
  • black beans: 1 can (15 oz)
  • corn: 1 cup
  • shredded cheese (cheddar or mexican blend): 2 cups
  • onion (diced): 1 medium
  • garlic (minced): 2 cloves
  • cumin: 1 teaspoon
  • chili powder: 1 teaspoon
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste

Date Created:

11/17/2024
